In pre-2oth century times in the West, it was common for armies to go
in=
to winter quarters
in late Fall and then begin the next campaign season aro=
und April or so.
This was
escpecially followed in Classical warfare.  Did t=
he Japanese follow this
same practice?? And if so, to what extent, and what=
 were the protocols??
I know about the Osaka winter
campaign (1614-15), but=
 I beleive that was somewhat of a rarity.

Michael C.
